basics.name: Jasvinder Singh Kwatra
basics.label: Sr Cloud Operations Engineer,Tier-4
basics.summary: I have ten years of experience in the design and implementation of solutions with multiple industry-leading open source technologies. I seek to utilize my skill set at a challenging new position, designing and developing a robust and secure virtualization solution, built to satisfy market needs.

work.summary: During my stint at Mirantis, I provided the highest tier of support and design consultation for a highly complex and continuously changing environment while utilizing the DevOps methodology. I have a drive for learning and creating new things that have enabled me to thrive in this challenging atmosphere. I am passionate about providing a customer experience that exceeds all expectations.
highlights: Restored an entire zone of 300 computes by creating a disaster recovery plan and executing it within 11 hours

Developed and provided an ops fix for an Openstack Nova-Compute bug, which had a widespread effect upon multiple production environments and multiple high profile clients, resulting in a loss of interconnection between all Openstack services. This fix saved the company many person-hours by ending a two year effort to find a solution and greatly improved the relationship with the client.
Recovered ceph cluster from pg corruption, avoiding any customer data loss.
Provided design feedback resulting in the overall stability of the Kubernetes, OpenStack, and non-OpenStack components of Airship, thus drastically increasing the success of the rate of deployments.
Resolved a long-standing OOM issue affecting all nodes across multiple data centers, identifying the root cause to be a design flaw in the tuning of Numa memory and Hugepage settings.
Provided proof of concepts for multiple system architecture solutions and took part in design discussions as well as defect resolutions.
Created disaster recovery procedures for various infrastructure components and wrote KBs for best practices.
Responsible for managing AT&T Integrated Cloud and Network cloud with 25K production and non-production bare-metal servers configured with both Openvswitch and Juniper Contrail.

work.summary: I was promoted to Technical Architect over AT&T's business service APIs leading 25 people and while in this position, I was awarded the 'ACE award 2017' for the second time and the 'Pat on the Back Award' in Q1 2018 for outstanding customer support.
highlights: Provided Proof of concepts utilizing Kubernetes/OpenStack technologies.
Solved high priority issue, which had caused numerous outages in the past six months with JVM memory leak and Postgress.
Provided RBAC use cases and converted non-SSL Kubernetes cluster to SSL only Kubernetes cluster manually and with Kubeadm and kubespray tools.
Created and updated Chef Cookbooks for infrastructure automation.
Created wrapper in the python to query 4000 servers, help reduce the troubleshooting time.

work.summary: I was transferred to the USA and assigned as lead over AT&T's business service APIs. I was awarded the 'ACE award 2016' for being a top performer and having numerous client appreciation.
highlights: Overcame budgetary limitations by migrating the Apigee platform and all associated APIs from tlsv1.0 to tlsv1.2, effectively sidestepping a lack of vendor support.
Developed a plan to complete a challenging migration of 51 zones to a newer version of Openstack, which was previously determined to be impossible by the reporting development team.
Executed critical migration of thirty-six Cassandra nodes while maintaining twenty-four operational nodes with zero downtime.
Created and updated Ceph Cookbooks for infrastructure automation.
Troubleshoot issues of memory leaks in JVM, Kernel, and APIs.

work.summary: I worked for AT&T business service APIs. I have designed and built 51 environments of the AT&T API platform within three months of joining the project and received the Pat on the back award in the Q3 of 2014.
highlights: Built new environments using neutron and Openstack.
Installed Apigee Edge cloud edition for exposing client APIs.
Configured Docker Containers for Jenkins and Gitlabs.
Configured Zookeeper and Cassandra nodes.

work.summary: I took charge of managing Ericsson datacenters across India, where I designed and implemented an automated system that efficiently backed up critical file systems and saved 1000 person-hours per project for which I was presented the 'Best Idea Award' in Q1 2013.
highlights: Developed preventive maintenance scripts for health checks on servers.
Proactively audited the network performance and identified issues with auto-negotiation, drastically reducing the number of outages due to performance issues.
